intro: Dianthus seguieri subsp. gautieri, commonly known as the Alpine campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial with compact, mat-forming foliage and showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are borne in dense clusters at the ends of the stems, and they have five petals that are often marked with darker veins. Dianthus seguieri subsp. gautieri thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and scree slopes.
